TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
Hello.

I am having an issue with scatterer's sea, or the lack of one. All i can see is the bottom of the water but no water itself. I used <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">ckan</abbr> to install everything. It worked at first but then randomly it dissapeared.

Pictures here:

[https://imgur.com/gallery/UZOxz](https://imgur.com/gallery/UZOxz)

Welcome to the forums [@Henrir2](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/181946-henrir2/).

I believe this is a known issue.  A scene change often clears it but it will return every once and a while.  It doesn't affect the actual water.

Ok, let's start with the versions of KSP and Scatterer you're using: KSP v1.2.2 and Scatterer v0.0315, neither of which are the latest versions.  Go to the <abbr title="1. Original Post(er). The first post in a thread, or the person who posted it. 2. Overpowered. A part or mechanic that upsets game balance by being too powerful.">OP</abbr> and try updating Scatterer to v0.0320 (if you're going to remain with KSP v1.2.2, don't upgrade to the absolute latest version of Scatterer which is for v1.3.0).  Someone wiser than me will confirm if there's a better version match.

Also, read this [thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/83212-how-to-get-support-read-first/) and post a link to your output\_log file if you're still having problems so people can see any errors/issues as KSP runs and all the mods you're installing.

I don't want to update right now just in case some of my mods will stop working, if i ever have the patience to do it, i will. <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> Says i have 69 mods on my install but i probably have more because some manually installed mods aren't recognized.

I loaded into my save and then exited out i hope that's good enough.

[http://www.mediafire.com/file/kuudour6263r112/output_log.txt](http://www.mediafire.com/file/kuudour6263r112/output_log.txt)

Edit: I made a fresh install with only scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> with medium resolution, the problem still remains. ( [https://imgur.com/gallery/gGzYZ )](https://imgur.com/gallery/gGzYZ)

Here's the output log of the install with only scatterer and <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>. I noticed that in the end of the log it said "[Scatterer] Stock oceans already removed". Maybe that has to do with something. ( [https://www.mediafire.com/file/qtrwn6xdjojv4zd/output_log.txt )](https://www.mediafire.com/file/qtrwn6xdjojv4zd/output_log.txt)

Hope this helps!

I have a bunch of null refs spamming in my KSP\_log ([https://pastebin.com/STUJX8NG](https://pastebin.com/STUJX8NG)) and my water is gone as well as the sky looks weird. I have AVP, <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>, scatterer, <abbr title="KSP Renaissance Compilation (mod)">KSPRC</abbr> (installed correctly), and kopernicus (these are just the visual mods I have, not all of them). Any ideas on whats wrong and how to fix them?

I am having black squares appear in 1.3 and I really don't want to disable ocean shaders. Can you please provide a set of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> compatible shaders for 1.3?

I am also having the halo or double rainbow around planets. Running on a Mac bought a week ago. KSP 1.3.1 from steam. Tested with just scatterer installed. Literally unplayable. Pics and info [here](https://imgur.com/gallery/XD5A7)!

Hi

I am having an issue where my log is being spammed at about once per frame with "NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object". I have other mods installed, but the log (download here: [https://uploadfiles.io/d59jv](https://uploadfiles.io/d59jv)) says "at scatterer.RefractionCamera.OnPreCull () [0x00000] in <filename unknown="">:0". Is this a known issue or bug? I am on KSP 1.2.2 with Scatterer 0.0320.
</filename>

Thanks

Turn off the water retractions in the main menu.
That fixed the issue. Thanks ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P")

Because I did the same but in game on the scatterer window it says it's 0.0315. If you install the 0.0320b version from here: [https://spacedock.info/mod/141/scatterer/download/0.0320b](https://spacedock.info/mod/141/scatterer/download/0.0320b) it gives you 0.0320b. So where's 0.0320?
The sunflare's not working properly in 1.3.1, its the thing where both the stock and scatterer sunflares are overlapping. I assume this'll be fixed soon
